title: Brown Dog Deli
description: Named one of Charleston's best dog-friendly spots. Special dog menu, water bowls, and a quirky, welcoming outdoor patio. Your pup eats well here too.
searchHint: Brown Dog Deli Charleston SC

title: Poogan's Porch
description: Historic Victorian home restaurant named after a beloved neighborhood dog. Southern comfort food with spacious porch seating — servers happily bring water bowls.
searchHint: Poogan's Porch 72 Queen St Charleston SC

title: Fleet Landing Restaurant & Bar
description: Waterfront dining on the harbor with a generous outdoor deck perfect for dogs. Fresh seafood, harbor views, and plenty of space for your pup to relax.
searchHint: Fleet Landing Restaurant 186 Concord St Charleston SC

title: Edmund's Oast Brewing Co.
description: NoMo neighborhood brewpub with a spacious dog-friendly patio — covered seating, fans, and water bowls. Craft beers brewed on-site and elevated comfort food.
searchHint: Edmund's Oast Brewing Co 1081 Morrison Dr Charleston SC

title: Revelry Brewing Co.
description: One of Charleston's most dog-welcoming breweries. Ample outdoor seating upstairs and down, staff provide water bowls, and you'll always see other dogs hanging out.
searchHint: Revelry Brewing Co 10 Conroy St Charleston SC

title: Bay Street Biergarten
description: German-inspired beer garden with a large outdoor courtyard ideal for dogs. Craft beers, pretzels, and a communal atmosphere where four-legged friends are welcome.
searchHint: Bay Street Biergarten 549 East Bay St Charleston SC

title: Dog and Duck
description: Award-winning pet-friendly pub with a laid-back patio. Classic pub fare, cold drinks, and a neighborhood vibe where dogs are regulars, not just visitors.
searchHint: Dog and Duck 1568 Ben Sawyer Blvd Mount Pleasant SC

title: Home Team BBQ - West Ashley
description: Legendary BBQ joint with a dog-friendly outdoor patio. Pulled pork, craft cocktails, live music, and a relaxed atmosphere where dogs are always welcome.
searchHint: Home Team BBQ 1205 Ashley River Rd Charleston SC

title: Saltwater Cowboys
description: Waterfront restaurant on Shem Creek with a dog-friendly deck overlooking the boats and dolphins. Fresh seafood and sunset views with your pup by your side.
searchHint: Saltwater Cowboys Shem Creek Mount Pleasant SC

title: Bowens Island Restaurant
description: Iconic Lowcountry oyster roast institution with outdoor seating on Folly Creek. Rustic, unforgettable, and dog-friendly — as Charleston as it gets.
searchHint: Bowens Island Restaurant 1870 Bowens Island Rd Charleston SC

title: Lost Dog Café
description: Folly Beach institution known for fantastic breakfast and laid-back vibes. Dog-friendly outdoor patio with a beach-casual atmosphere your pup will love.
searchHint: Lost Dog Cafe 106 W Huron Ave Folly Beach SC

title: Red's Ice House
description: Shem Creek waterfront bar with a casual outdoor deck. Cold beer, fresh seafood, and sunset views — bring your dog for the quintessential creek-side experience.
searchHint: Red's Ice House 98 Church St Mount Pleasant SC

title: Poe's Tavern
description: Sullivan's Island burger joint with a spacious, dog-friendly patio. Creative burgers named after Poe works, cold beers, and island vibes.
searchHint: Poe's Tavern 2210 Middle St Sullivan's Island SC

title: Dunleavy's Pub
description: Sullivan's Island neighborhood pub with a welcoming outdoor area. Cold drinks, casual bites, and the kind of laid-back island atmosphere that dogs (and their owners) love.
searchHint: Dunleavy's Pub 2213 Middle St Sullivan's Island SC

title: The Obstinate Daughter
description: Sullivan's Island restaurant with a dog-friendly patio. Creative Italian-inspired coastal cuisine, craft cocktails, and a popular weekend brunch spot.
searchHint: The Obstinate Daughter 2063 Middle St Sullivan's Island SC

title: The Kingstide
description: Daniel Island waterfront restaurant with rooftop and ground-level outdoor seating. Dogs welcome on the patio with views of the Wando River.
searchHint: The Kingstide 32 River Landing Dr Daniel Island SC

title: Dog Park at James Island County Park
description: 4-acre off-leash dog park with a dog beach, separate small-breed area, washing station, and lake access. USA Today Runner-up Best Dog Park. $2 park entry fee.
searchHint: James Island County Park Dog Park 871 Riverland Dr Charleston SC

title: Dog Park at Wannamaker County Park
description: Large off-leash area with separate spaces for big and small dogs, a Splash Paw spray fountain, washing area, and shaded seating under mature trees.
searchHint: Wannamaker County Park Dog Park 8888 University Blvd North Charleston SC

title: Brittlebank Park
description: Downtown's off-leash dog area along the Ashley River with views of the Ravenel Bridge. Non-fenced but spacious — a favorite for city-dwelling dog owners. Dawn to dusk.
searchHint: Brittlebank Park 185 Lockwood Dr Charleston SC

title: Palmetto Islands County Park
description: Nature park in Mount Pleasant with dog-friendly trails through maritime forests and marshland. Great for walks and exploring with your leashed pup.
searchHint: Palmetto Islands County Park Long Point Rd Mount Pleasant SC

title: Sullivan's Island Beach
description: Dog-friendly beach with seasonal off-leash hours (early morning before 10 AM). Town permit required ($25 residents, $50 visitors). One of the best dog beaches in the area.
searchHint: Sullivan's Island Beach Sullivan's Island SC

title: Isle of Palms Beach
description: Seven miles of dog-friendly beach with off-leash hours early morning and evening. Free annual dog permit encouraged. Wide sandy beach perfect for fetch and swimming.
searchHint: Isle of Palms Beach Isle of Palms SC

title: Folly Beach
description: Dogs allowed year-round with seasonal time restrictions (no dogs 10 AM-6 PM, May-Sept). Must stay leashed. A fun beach outing for you and your dog.
searchHint: Folly Beach SC

title: Ackerman Park Dog Park
description: Fenced off-leash dog park on James Island with separate areas for large and small dogs. Well-maintained and popular with local dog owners. Dawn to dusk.
searchHint: Ackerman Park 55 Sycamore Ave Charleston SC

title: Hampton Park
description: Charleston's largest public park with beautiful gardens and wide paths perfect for dog walking. Leashes required but plenty of space to roam and socialize.
searchHint: Hampton Park Charleston SC

title: Waterfront Park
description: Iconic downtown park along the harbor with the famous Pineapple Fountain. Dogs welcome on leash — great for a scenic walk with harbor views and cool breezes.
searchHint: Waterfront Park Vendue Range Charleston SC

title: The Royal American
description: Dive bar with a big heart and an even bigger dog-friendly outdoor space. Live music, creative cocktails, and a funky atmosphere where dogs are part of the scene.
searchHint: The Royal American 970 Morrison Dr Charleston SC

title: Charles Towne Landing State Historic Site
description: 80 acres of dog-friendly trails through the original 1670 Charleston settlement site. Leashed dogs welcome on paths through old-growth forests along the Ashley River.
searchHint: Charles Towne Landing State Historic Site 1500 Old Towne Rd Charleston SC

title: Grove Street Dog Park
description: Downtown fenced dog park with separate areas for large and small dogs. Convenient city location for quick off-leash play sessions. Dawn to dusk.
searchHint: Grove Street Dog Park Charleston SC
